page.title: 01LANDSCAPE TRICKETT'S CROSS
page.content: The land around the{Trickett's Cross and{St Leonards}area is covered mainly by heath; with meadows, marshes and woodland beside the Moors River. The Trickett's Cross housing estate consists of council houses, flats for the elderly and private housing. The southern part of the D-block covers part of the Ferndown{golf}course and {Hurn Airport. The owners of the houses bordering the golf course represent the affluent members of the local population. There are several{hotels}in the area, but the largest is the Dormy. Visitors to the international golf tournaments often stay there. The Coach House Motel by the Trickett's Cross roundabout was the first of its kind in the south of England. There are holiday and residential{caravan sites in the area.
